titleStmt.title: byang chub sems dpa' yi bslabs pa kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad
titleStmt.author: 'jad pa byang chub skyabs

editionStmt.edition: Digital Edition in Wylie with TEI Markup

licence.p: The Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) licence applies to this document.

physDesc.additional: Script: dpe tshugs. 196 folios are extant. No folio with No. 90, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 89 and fol. 91. Two folios are numbered 125 between fol. 124 and fol. 126. No folio with No. 128, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 127 and fol. 129. Between fol. 151 and 154, one folio numbered 152-53. No folio with No. 170, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 169 and fol. 171. No folio with No. 180, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 179 and fol. 181. Fol. 187 is numbered "187-8." The folio between fol. 187 and fol. 190 is numbered 188-89. No folio with No. 190, but there does not seem to be a text gap between fol. 188-89 and fol. 191. After fol. 197, two sets of folio numbers. The second continues with 198, 199, etc. up to 202. The first with 198-99, 199', 201 'og ma, 202 gong ma, 226. It is yet to be ascertained whether there are gaps in the text between the folios. The text starts on fol. 1a (no cover page) Use of abbreviations. Some longer glosses have been written within the main text, indicating that they were copied together with the main text. Glosses identify scholars whose views are referred to in the main text. The glosses are only found in some sections.

projectDesc.p: This document was created and is made available in the framework of the ERC project “The Dawn of Tibetan Buddhist Scholasticism (11th-13th c.) (TibSchol). This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement No. 101001002). See https://cordis.europa.eu/project/id/101001002

prefixDef.p: In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "db" prefix point to the project's APIS instance, a database system to collect information of entities.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "per" prefix point to the BDRC's data interface's person module.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "zot" prefix point to a record in the projects's Zotero group.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "corpusmd" prefix point to any element in the corpus TEI document via its ID.

body.ab: byang chub sems dpa' yi bslabs pa kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad ces bya ba | shag kya'i dge slong byang chub skyabs kyis sbyar ba'o || × || rdzogs s+ho ||
ces pa sa 'byed pa don grub kyis ming can gyi bris lags so |
